oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jimmie Davis Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Jimmie Davis (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmie Davis; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie introduces Jimmie Davis and Davis begins to speak of his hometown and Roy Acuff -- (01:40) Collie speaks of family familiarity to Davis -- (03:00) Davis continues to speak about hometown, being a little boy on Christmas, and the family cat-- (05:00) Davis discusses singing with harmony in the family -- (06:45) Davis discusses the first automobile in town and schooling -- (09:40) Davis talks about his high school class of three members -- (10:43) Davis speaks of teaching -- (13:12) Speaks about working as a clerk in the local courthouse -- (13:40) Davis speaks of being in charge of public safety and running for public servant -- (14:35) Davis speaks about being a musician and being asked to run for governor -- (16:43) Davis speaks of Jim Rodgers influence -- (17:45) Davis speaks of recording ' You Are My Sunshine' -- (20:38) Davis discusses recording with Bing Crosby -- (21:55)Davis and Collie discuss the introduction to 'You Are My Sunshine' and international popularity -- (25:30) Davis speak of the musical influence behind campaigning -- (28:28) Davis talks about Moon Mulligan's funeral -- (31:00) Davis speaks about using the band in campaigning -- (33:38) Collie inquires Davis about recording using vocals instead of horns and simplicity in music -- (36:18) Davis retells a story of asking people for tires and not having a band for an event -- (38:04) Davis speaks of his bass player who committed suicide and Davis' sickness during their time together -- (41:16) Davis speaks of his traveling stage -- (42:40) Davis speaks of being an LSU professor -- (43:00) Davis speaks of family size and "Cracklin Bread" -- (45:47) Davis speaks about an experience with president Cleveland -- (48:45) Davis talking about president Truman staying with Davis -- (50:00) Davis speaks of playing for Truman at the democratic convention -- (52:25) Davis speaks of being president and his connections in Washington D.C. -- (54:48) Davis discusses being bucked from a black horse and being pranked -- (56:56) Davis speaks about a time where his stagecoach horses got lose / proceeded to tear down fencing -- (58:01) Davis speaks of film work on 'Louisiana' -- (58:32) -- Davis speaks about meeting Babe Ruth and his declining health -- (59:26) Davis continues to speak of 'Louisiana' and 'Mississippi Rhythm' -- (1:01:41) Davis speaks about a state senator regarding him as an outgoing personality -- (1:02:39) Davis speaks about his way to getting to know people -- (1:03:55) Davis speaks of criticism obtained for running for office -- (1:07:09) Davis speaks about the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (1:09:06) Davis concludes that his greatest accomplishments were his experiences
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Davis, Jimmie; Davis, Jimmie, 1899-2000;
